name: app error handler
sempv2 mqttSession
info:
SempV2 mqttSession REST calls.

See [Solace SempV2 Help](https://docs.solace.com/API-Developer-Online-Ref-Documentation/swagger-ui/config/index.html#/) - mqttSession

# Input

* msg and properties
    * properties override msg if they are defined
 
## Elements

* ``instanceName``: name used in error / debug messages - best to copy/paste the subflow name here
* ``solaceBrokerId``: unique id / name of the configuration 
    * format: solaceBrokerId.match(/^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$/)   
* ``apiCall``: 
    * ``getListOfMqttSessionObjects``
    * ``getMqttSessionObject``
    * ``getMqttSessionSubscriptions``
    * ``updateMqttSessionObject``
    * ``deleteMqttSessionSubscriptionObject``
    * ``createMqttSessionSubscriptionObject``
    * ``deleteMqttSessionObject``

## Return
* ``msg.success`` = ``true`` if no error
* result of apiCall  
* no return in case of error

## Exceptions

* Throws exceptions using node.error()

## Example Inputs:

### Get all Mqtt Session Objects
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'getListOfMqttSessionObjects'
}
```
### Get Mqtt Session Object
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'getMqttSessionObject',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>'
    }
}
```
### Get Mqtt Session Subscriptions
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'getMqttSessionSubscriptions',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>'
    }
}
```
### Update Mqtt Session
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'updateMqttSessionObject',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>',
        body: {
            enabled: true/false,
            ... (as per documentation)
        }
    }
}
```
### Delete Mqtt Session Subscription Object
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'deleteMqttSessionSubscriptionObject',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>',
        topic:'<the topic subscription to delete>'
    }
}
```
### Create Mqtt Session Subscription Object
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'createMqttSessionSubscriptionObject',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>',
        body: {
            subscriptionQoS: 0 or 1,
            subscriptionTopic: '<the topic subscription>',
            ... (as per documentation)
        }
    }
}
```

### Delete Mqtt Session Object
```json
msg.sempV2mqttSession = {
    solaceBrokerId: '<the config id>',
    apiCall: 'deleteMqttSessionObject',
    apiCallParams: {
        mqttSessionClientId: '<the client id>'
    }
}
```

name: sempv2 config
info:
Configuration node for a Solace broker instance for the ``solace.sempv2`` nodes.

[see solace.sempv2.config](http://github.com/.../node-red-contrib-solace-sempv2/doc/sempv2.config.md)

---
The End.

name: TestSolaceErrorSubFlow
info:
Test/example using SolaceError within a sub flow.


# Input

## Mandatory Input Fields

* ``componentName`` [string] [hidden constant] - the name of the component
* ``instanceName`` [string] [user entered] - the name of the instance of the sub flow. copy/paste the name of the subflow, this allows for easy searching in case of an error. 

## Custom Input Properties

__Note: custom properties can either be set manually or via incoming msg.payload. Manually set properties override incoming msg.payload properties.__

* ``property1`` [string] [mandatory] - a custom, mandatory, string input property. Flow tests for: is not empty, is a string and throws a SolaceError in case tests not successful. 

# Output

* msg [object] - the incoming msg with properties added


# Exception

* ``SolaceError``



-----
The End.

name: sempv2 about

[see solace.sempv2.about](http://github.com/.../node-red-contrib-solace-sempv2/doc/sempv2.about.md)

name: forEach
info:
Iterate over an input array of items and send item by item to output after receiving the next input.
This is a stateful node, it saves state per instance in parent flow and in the output msg. Use the output msg as the input to trigger the next item (or end) send.


[see solace.utils.forEach](http://github.com/.../node-red-contrib-solace-utils/doc/utils.forEach.md)

name: subflow error handler
info:
Solace Utils: Error handler for subflows.

**_do not use as is, build an app specific subflow that wraps this one_**

## Inputs

``msg._solaceUtilsSubflowErrorHandler`` with:

- ``solaceUtilsGlobalContext`` - global context path of the Solace utils functions
- ``solaceAppUtilsGlobalContext`` - global context path of the Solace app utils functions
- ``solaceAppUtilsComponentGlobalContext`` - global context path of the component functions in ``solaceAppUtilsGlobalContext``

Example:

```js
msg._solaceUtilsSubflowErrorHandler = {
    solaceUtilsGlobalContext: '_solaceUtils',
    solaceAppUtilsGlobalContext: '_solaceAppUtils',
    solaceAppUtilsComponentGlobalContext: 'app'
};
```
